page.title: 16G.W.R.150 VISITS E.SWINDON
page.content: Each school has tackled the project in various ways, but generally many similar things have taken place. {Visits:- Locally, to the{Railway Museum}and {Railway Village.}Further afield to the {Swindon and Cricklade Railway,}a small length of line owned by enthusiasts with a few working engines. Even further, trips to{Didcot}with many more steam engines including{"Blue {Peter". Others concentrated on Brunel and visited{The Box Tunnel, Bristol Temple {Meads, The Clifton Suspension Bridge and{The S.S.Great Britain. British Rail organised trips on modern trains between Swindon and Chippenham and Swindon and Kemble. A great deal was learned and a great many drinks, sandwiches and crisps were consumed.
